meanings.definition: The act of making something seem less important or serious.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's minimization of the student's mistake helped him feel less embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: The minimization of the issue by the manager led to misunderstandings among the team.
meanings.sent3: During the comedy show, the minimization of the comedian's failed joke made the audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: Her minimization of the problem was like sweeping dust under the rug, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent5: The minimization of the error in the report made it easier for everyone to move on and focus on the solution.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing something to the smallest possible amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: The minimization of the ingredients in the recipe made it quick and easy to prepare.
meanings.sent2: The minimization of expenses helped the company save money during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The minimization of the cake size turned out to be a big hit at the party, as everyone loved the cute mini cakes.
meanings.sent4: His minimization of his wardrobe to only essential items was like decluttering his life.
meanings.sent5: The minimization of distractions in the workspace increased productivity and focus among the employees.
